alert.note: Alert for Sioux (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 9:51PM CDT until further notice by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Brookings and Moody Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... South Dakota...Minnesota... Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River above Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha and Moody Counties. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Plymouth and Union Counties. Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Lincoln, Sioux and Union Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. Rock River at Luverne affecting Rock County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River above Hawarden. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, some farm houses on the South Dakota side of the river are isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Monday the stage was 22.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Monday was 22.2 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 24.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall Wednesday evening. It will rise to 23.4 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall again but remain above flood stage. - Flood stage is 20.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Big Sioux River Hawarden 20.5 22.2 Mon 8 pm 23.9 23.1 23.4 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
